title: How to Color Fondant

steps.headline: Knead the fondant with your hands.
steps.description: Make sure that it is very soft.

steps.headline: Roll into a sausage or tube shape.
steps.description: This provides more surface for applying the color to.

steps.headline: Dab just a little of the frosting color onto the tool you're using.
steps.description: Use something small and pointed, such as a clean artists brush or a toothpick.

steps.headline: Stroke the color across the fondant surface.
steps.description: Draw it across the surface as far as it will go. Avoid digging into the fondant. This can introduce unwanted pockets of air, which can leave bubbles in the fondant.

steps.headline: Roll the fondant with your fingertips.
For an even, complete colored effect, knead or roll until the coloring has spread throughout the whole fondant.
Choose a coloring type.
steps.description:
There is a wide variety of possible colorings for use with fondant, including:
Paste colors - only use a tiny quantity as this is very concentrated
Gel colors - this is a strong color and it's easy to use
Powder colors - this needs to be dissolved in liquid before use to avoid undissolved pieces showing in the fondant
Liquid colors - use cake decorating versions to ensure nice consistency
Lustres - for adding a sheen.

steps.headline: Be aware of a few issues with some colors:
